intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the dwarf goldenstar, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, typically growing in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a glossy texture and a dark green color. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
